results.title: Reduced decline of lung diffusing capacity in COPD patients with diabetes and metformin treatment
results.text_hl: While @<m>DISEASE_Emphysema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004646 @@@emphysema@@@ is considered to be linked to premature aging, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ is discussed as potential anti-aging medication.

citations.NLM: Kahnert K, Andreas S, Kellerer C, Lutter JI, Lucke T, Yildirim Ö, Lehmann M, Seissler J, Behr J, Frankenberger M, Bals R, Watz H, Welte T, Trudzinski FC, Vogelmeier CF, Alter P, Jörres RA, COSYCONET Study Group. Reduced decline of lung diffusing capacity in COPD patients with diabetes and metformin treatment Sci Rep. 2022 Jan 26;12(1):1435. PMID: 35082306

results.journal: Am J Respir Crit Care Med
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@: Experimental and Clinical Evidence for a Potential Role in @<m>DISEASE_Emphysema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004646 @@@Emphysema@@@ Treatment.

results.title: Post-COPD: Can Emphysema Be Repaired?
results.journal: Am J Respir Crit Care Med
results.text_hl: Several approved medications targeting pathways involved in lung repair could be tested to treat @<m>DISEASE_Emphysema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004646 @@@emphysema@@@ (e.g., @CHEMICAL_Tretinoin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014212 @@@all-trans retinoic acid@@@, @CHEMICAL_Thiazolidinediones @CHEMICAL_MESH:D045162 @@@thiazolidinediones@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs, and @CHEMICAL_Lithium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008094 @@@lithium@@@).

citations.NLM: Wells JM, Krishnan JA, Wade RC, Kinney G, Wise RA, Neptune E, Polverino F, Hanania NA, Moll M, Königshoff M, Chandra D, Sciurba F, Marchetti N, San José Estépar R, Diaz AA, El-Kersh K, Castro M, Zhang Y, Holbrook JT, Sugar EA, Kraft M, Kaner RJ, Make B, Rennard S. results.title: Metformin suppresses epithelial sodium channel hyperactivation and its associated phenotypes in a mouse model of obstructive lung diseases.
results.text_hl: One possible modulator of @GENE_SCNN1A @GENE_20276 @@@ENaC@@@ is @GENE_PRKAB1 @GENE_5564 @@@AMP-activated protein kinase@@@ (@GENE_PRKAB1 @GENE_5564 @@@AMPK@@@), a key molecule that controls a wide variety of cellular signals; however, little is known about whether @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, a clinically available @GENE_PRKAB1 @GENE_5564 @@@AMPK@@@ activator, has a protective role against @GENE_SCNN1A @GENE_20276 @@@ENaC@@@-associated @DISEASE_Chronic_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D002908 @@@chronic pulmonary phenotypes@@@, such as @<m>DISEASE_Emphysema</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004646 @@@emphysema@@@ and @DISEASE_Pulmonary_Heart_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D011660 @@@pulmonary dysfunction@@@.

citations.NLM: Nakashima R, Nohara H, Takahashi N, Nasu A, Hayashi M, Kishimoto T, Kamei S, Fujikawa H, Maruta K, Kawakami T, Eto Y, Ueno-Shuto K, Suico MA, Kai H, Shuto T. Metformin suppresses epithelial sodium channel hyperactivation and its associated phenotypes in a mouse model of obstructive lung diseases. J Pharmacol Sci. 2022 Jun;149(2):37-45. PMID: 35512853
